dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so I was just reading this fascinating piece about Poland, post-election, and it really got me thinking.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so I was just reading this fascinating piece about Poland, post-election, and it really got me thinking.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, the one by Miron Mironiuk? The tech entrepreneur?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, the one by Miron Mironiuk? The tech entrepreneur?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Miron Mironiuk is Founder and CEO of Cosmose AI

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! He’s, like, calling for a completely new vision for the country, not just for the next four or eight years, but for the next twenty-five.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! He's, like, calling for a completely new vision for the country, not just for the next four or eight years, but for the next twenty-five.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Today, I see a country that needs a strategy for the long haul not just for the next four or eight years, but for the next 25.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I mean, the way he puts it – as an entrepreneur, but also as someone who owes his success to Poland. It’s a really grounded perspective.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I mean, the way he puts it - as an entrepreneur, but also as someone who owes his success to Poland. It's a really grounded perspective.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As the Polish founder of a technology company, I view Polands opportunities through the eyes of an entrepreneur. Yet as the son of a plumber who attended an ordinary public school, I also see things through the lens of someone who owes his success to Poland.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. And, um, he sets this incredibly audacious goal, right? To be one of the top ten wealthiest countries by 2050.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. And, um, he sets this incredibly audacious goal, right? To be one of the top ten wealthiest countries by twenty fifty.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For starters, we should make it a national goal to become one of the worlds ten wealthiest countries (in per capita terms) by 2050.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right! [overlaps] Which, on the surface, sounds insane. But then he points out their GDP per capita has already increased tenfold in the last 30 years.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right! Which, on the surface, sounds insane. But then he points out their G D P per capita has already increased tenfold in the last thirty years.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Polands GDP per capita has increased tenfold in the last 30 years.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's wild. And he really emphasizes their strengths, especially, like, human capital. Their software engineers are apparently incredible.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's wild. And he really emphasizes their strengths, especially, like, human capital. Their software engineers are apparently incredible.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Our biggest strength is clearly our human capital. Poland boasts some of the best software engineers in the world...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, for sure. He calls software engineering talent the "new oil," and says Poland is Saudi Arabia. I mean, ten of OpenAI's first fifty employees were Polish, um, which is quite something.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, for sure. He calls software engineering talent the new oil, and says Poland is Saudi Arabia. I mean, ten of OpenAI's first fifty employees were Polish, um, which is quite something.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If software-engineering talent is the new oil, Poland is Saudi Arabia. ...our contributions to breakthroughs like ChatGPT (ten of OpenAIs first 50 employees being Polish.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's a huge stat! And their education system, you know, ranks really high internationally. So he's pushing to make computer programming a fundamental skill for every student.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's a huge stat! And their education system, you know, ranks really high internationally. So he's pushing to make computer programming a fundamental skill for every student.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Poland also has a world-class education system, as demonstrated by our top-ten placement in the OECDs Program for International Student Assessment rankings... Since we already have a system that works, we should now make computer programming a fundamental skill that every student learns.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Which, uh, makes so much sense, given that strength. But then he pivots to the hurdles, which are, like, pretty significant.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, uh, makes so much sense, given that strength. But then he pivots to the hurdles, which are, like, pretty significant.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, the business environment. Fourth most challenging place to do business in Europe? That's, um, a tough one. All that red tape.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, the business environment. Fourth most challenging place to do business in Europe? That's, um, a tough one. All that red tape.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Though Polands education system ranks highly, we are the fourth most challenging place to do business in Europe.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right? [overlaps] Even with that, their tech scene is thriving. Like, half a million engineers in Poland. Imagine if it was *easier* to do business there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? Even with that, their tech scene is thriving. Like, half a million engineers in Poland. Imagine if it was easier to do business there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: My own company is one of more than more than 37,000 Polish technology enterprises employing half a million engineers and IT experts.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. So it's about, like, removing those barriers and really leveraging that talent.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. So it's about, like, removing those barriers and really leveraging that talent.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And, um, he makes a really good point at the end, too. This isn't just about Poland's prosperity, but about regional stability, especially with, you know, everything happening in Europe.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And, um, he makes a really good point at the end, too. This isn't just about Poland's prosperity, but about regional stability, especially with, you know, everything happening in Europe.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Now that war has returned to the continent, success in implementing such a strategy matters not only for Poland, but for Europe. A strong Polish economy on the technological cutting edge can make a profound contribution to regional stability and prosperity.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, a strong, tech-savvy Poland really contributes to the whole continent.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, a strong, tech-savvy Poland really contributes to the whole continent.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. It needs that shared vision, though.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. It needs that shared vision, though.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But to get there, we will need a shared vision and the political will to achieve it.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. Gotta get to work!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. Gotta get to work!
